intro: Myrsine albiflorens, commonly known as the whiteflower myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a slightly waxy texture. Myrsine albiflorens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
